alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a halogen atom, which is indirectly attached to a carbonyl via an intervening vinyl (>C=C<) moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Vinylogous halides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds contaning a chlorine atom attached to the alpha carbon atom relative to C=O group.
alternative_parents.name: Alpha-chloroketones

alternative_parents.description: Vinyl halides in which a chlorine atom is bonded to an sp2-hybridised carbon atom.
alternative_parents.name: Vinyl chlorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds having the structure RC#N; thus C-substituted derivatives of hydrocyanic acid, HC#N.
alternative_parents.name: Nitriles

alternative_parents.description: Compounds derived from an alkene by replacing a hydrogen atom with a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Chloroalkenes

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
class.name: Organooxygen compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as p-benzoquinones. These are benzoquinones where the two C=O groups are attached at the 1- and 4-positions, respectively.

direct_parent.description: Benzoquinones where the two C=O groups are attached at the 1- and 4-positions, respectively.
direct_parent.name: P-benzoquinones

intermediate_nodes.description: Organic compounds  in which a carbonyl group is bonded to two carbon atoms R2C=O (neither R may be a hydrogen atom). Ketones that have one or more alpha-hydrogen atoms undergo keto-enol tautomerization, the tautomer being an enol.
intermediate_nodes.name: Ketones

intermediate_nodes.description: Organic compounds containing a ketone that is conjugated to a cyclic moiety.
intermediate_nodes.name: Cyclic ketones

intermediate_nodes.description: Compounds having a fully conjugated cyclic dione structure, such as that of benzoquinones, derived from aromatic compounds by conversion of an even number of number of -CH= groups into -C(=O)- groups with any necessary rearrangement of double bonds (polycyclic and heterocyclic analogues are included).
intermediate_nodes.name: Quinones

intermediate_nodes.description: Organic compounds containing a benzene ring that carries two ketone group at the 1- and 4-positions (cyclohexa-2,5-diene-1,4-dione).
intermediate_nodes.name: Benzoquinones

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
subclass.name: Carbonyl compounds

superclass.description: Organic compounds that contain one or more oxygen atoms.
superclass.name: Organic oxygen compounds
